body:
This PR turns intel-mkl and intel-parallel-studio into scalapack providers...for most MPIs, anyway.

A couple of things are iffy:

- scalapack should be provided when ^mpi (is this valid?). There's a test for that later that raises an exception if there are no known MPI implementations in the spec, though.
- It doesn't support Intel MPI because afaik there's no way to distinguish between ^intel-parallel-studio being pulled for Intel MPI or the rest of the stuff in the package. (including scalapack itself)
title: MKL: Provide scalapack
